Reviews.Title: “"A major let down although well located"”
Reviews.Author: Taurotauro
Reviews.Content: Having traveled continuously to France, including Paris, over a period of well over 40 years as well as in numerous other countries in the world I am well aware that although Paris is a fabulous city, it can be difficult to get a good sized hotel room even if one pays a fortune. Still, Hotel de Buci was a shock and major let down. Although well situation in central Saint Germain des Pres near numerous cafes, restaurants, metro stations, and tourist sites, the bedroom that my spouse and I received was so tiny that all four of our suitcases had to be sent down to storage. It was TINY, TINY, TINY. In such a room, virtually the only thing one could do was to stay in the bed. Also, the room lack a good desk or table and was so dark that it would have been impossible to do any serious reading there. As we were aware that French hotels almost never offer face cloths in the bathroom, we came prepared with our own. Still it was a major effort not to get the maid to remove them from the bathroom whenever she made up the room. Hotel de Buci, even by Paris stardards, is very overpriced. Although French and English newspapers and access to a single computer in the downstairs sitting area were available at no extra cost and it remains a mystery to me how it could have ever been rated with four stars. Since even the tiny safes in the rooms are not bolted down, if anyone ever got into a room, they could walk out with a bedroom safe.

Reviews.Title: “Such a delight!”
Reviews.Author: Jenks333
Reviews.Content: 15 of us traveling together stayed at the de Buci for 8 days in early February 2012. The rooms were comfortable and clean, the breakfast was wonderful, and the staff was incredibly helpful and pleasant! The concierge filled every request promptly.The location just off the Boulevard St. Germain is optimal, with many of the major Paris sights an easy walk, a wide variety of eateries nearby, access to several metro lines, and even a grocery store just down the block. Especially check out the City Crepes just around the corner. We WILL be staying at the de Buci the next time we are in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, relaxing, friendly and fun.”
Reviews.Author: StephB00th
Reviews.Content: 100% satisfied! my partner and i stayed in hotel de buci over valentines and what a trip it turned out to be. our initial reaction was great as we walked through our immediate location to get to the hotel. the hotel is not only situated in a very social area, but you can easily access most of the tourist attractions from the hotel. the hotels area is lively and fun- really beautiful looking rest and relaxed but lively bars. the streets were lovely with some hidden art from street artists. when we arrived at the hotel we were blowen away by its unique interior. our bedroom was beautiful. people have previously complained about the size of hotel de buci's room sizes, however we found it cozy. the bed was lovely and comfortable, and the overall room was a delight. the staff were also a pleasure. very helpful with everything- anything you ask them regarding the hotel or your day trips, they will help you to best of their abilities. very happy!

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately a big let down - don't book tickets”
Reviews.Author: joe7238
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were really looking forward to staying at Hotel de Buci, unfortunately our stay was riddled with errors and problems that we didn’t expect from a four star hotel, or, at least, we would expect the hotel to make the errors up to us in some way. When we first arrived at the hotel, the concierge and lobby impressed us. The common areas are very beautiful. We stayed in a suite, which was very small. I'm glad we got the suite, as I can't imagine how small the normal rooms were. The hotel has the concierge change over throughout the day/night, but they didn't seem to pass on messages to each other if they were meant to do something for us. On the first day of our stay, we asked the concierge to book us tickets to the Moulin rouge and Disneyland tickets. We came back that evening, and neither had been booked, they called Moulin rouge straight away and said it was sold out. So we asked the concierge to book the tickets for either one of the following two nights, and that we wanted Disneyland tickets for the next day. The concierge said we would have to come back in the morning and do it al then. So the next morning we asked a different concierge for the same thing, he said he wasn't sure if he could do the Disneyland tickets, and to come back in 15 mins. So we did, and he had them, so paid the 12 euro commission for organising the tickets. We again said that we wanted Moulin rouge tickets for that evening or the next. When we arrived at Disneyland and tried to hand over our voucher, the ticket officer pointed out that the voucher the concierge gave us was clearly out of date (which it was, in big bold print). We had to pay the full fare, without any discounts. Disneyland wanted to know where we got the tickets from, as they were unhappy that hotels were selling expired tickets - we were unhappy too. Upon arriving back at the hotel, we told the same concierge what happened and that we had to pay full fare, we weren't happy. He just gave us our 12 euro back and apologised. For this, from a four star hotel, I expected more than a simple apology, he could have made it up to us in some other way. We asked about the Moulin rouge tickets and if he had organised the tickets. He hadn’t organised them. Are you serious? We were asking for these tickets for three days by now. He called and found out that that evening was booked out, and our next evening had a private party, so we couldn't attend. We felt that if the concierge had booked them when we asked, we wouldn't have missed out on seeing the show during our time in Paris – we were there for almost a week! We should have booked them ourselves. Our final, most stressful experience was the last day upon check out. The previous night we organised an airport shuttle through, you guessed it, the concierge. The concierge confirmed 8am for the shuttle. The next morning, as we're getting ready, we receive a phone call from the concierge at 7.30am saying that the shuttle will be here at 7.45. That's okay, we thought, 15 minutes to go, we’d be able to pack quickly. 5 minutes later (7.35 am), the concierge called back and said that the shuttle is here now, and if we don't come down straight away they would have to cancel it. What?? We asked for another 5-10 minutes, but they wouldn't budge. We asked them to call us a different shuttle, as we couldn't come down right away - they said no, not with this amount of short notice. I told them they confirmed 8am to us, that it wasn't our problem if they got their times mixed up, we shouldn't be penalised for their mistake. Their response was "you didn't speak to me last night when you confirmed"...no accountability, they were just passing the blame. We threw absolutely everything in one go into our bags and ran out the door. At the airport, we had to open up our bags and re-pack so things wouldn't spill etc. A miserable and stressful experience. Housekeeping needs to be reviewed - small things, but everyday, something was wrong/out of ordinary i.e. when we first checked in, we had bath water in the bottom quarter of the bath...that evening, we had two chocolates plopped next to our change by the door, the next day, a set of pillow cases was left by the television, and all our towels were replaced but one went missing. On the following day, another towel went missing. The housekeeping inconsistencies didn’t bother us too much, it was the other experiences at the hotel de buci that made our stay disappointing. Good points - Blockout blinds were great. Concierge could speak English well, good location. A friend who is going to Paris in a few weeks asked me about the hotel and whether she should stay there - I said No.

Reviews.Title: “Well presented little hotel with friendly staff in congenial location but sadly with major temperature  and air flow flaw”
Reviews.Author: PamelaBruce
Reviews.Content: There were many pluses to his little hotel. It is located in a bustling narrow street with a small flower market and plenty of cafes witg English speaking staff with the Parisian almost cliched French awnings. There are two Metro stations St Germain des Pres and Mabillon within easy walking distance. A great deal of trouble has been taken with the interior decoration of the hotel and our Contemporaine room was comfortable albeit with little room either to put clothes away or move about between the furniture. The hotel had placed presents of pesto, olive oil and chocolate biscuits in the room and the staff were very anxious to attend to any request. There is however one very serious negative about which I did let the hotel management know in the feedback form provided. On the first night therey husband and I found the room to be far too hot so turned the dial on the room temperature control down to 16 degrees. This made no discern able difference to the temperature at all. We obeyed the warning a notice in the room that we were not to open the window so as not to waste the energy involved in heating and cooling the rooms We told the staff member on duty at the reception desk about this and he advised us to turn it off. This was a mistake as we then had no air flow whatever which made sleep impossible without opening the window. When we did tackle the window if would only stay open in a fully open position which rendered the room icy.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous gem in the heart of St Germain”
Reviews.Author: Zouppy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel on a three day business trip. Fantastic location, and staff were very helpful. Room was small, though what else do you expect from a Paris Hotel. Highly recommend it, either for business or pleasure. Loved it, and would stay there again. Try Fish around the corner, for fantastic food!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Excellent part of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Dids50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June 2010 and it was wonderful! Excellent service, wonderful breakfast included in the tarriff, good size rooms for Paris and certainly in a terrific spot for authentic Brasserie and small galleries and all the usual landmaks. Would return in a flash!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Paul N
Reviews.Content: Always a moral struggle to write a review like this. They only have 24 rooms, and we really don't want them to be sold out when we next visit Paris (we do regularly now that we have a daughter living there), but they deserve to be full! Very stylish, lovely rooms and great bathrooms too. The location is just fabulous assuming the heart of St. Germain is your cup of tea. Very competent, sophisticated, attentive English speaking staff. All in all quite a sophisticated, elegant, understated little boutique hotel at a very fair price. Rue de Buci looks like a movie set version of Paris. Outdoor cafes bursting with life at all hours. Less than a minute walk to Fish (69 Rue de Seine - see reviews), and in the opposite direction (6 Rue de Bourbon Le Chateau) to a sensational wine store, Le Derniere Goutte, owned by Fish. Wine tastings at just about every hour. Another local restaurant recommendation: L'Epigramme at 9, Rue de L'Epiron, a five minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and atmospheric”
Reviews.Author: MDMortimer
Reviews.Content: This is the first review I have been moved to write on Trip Advisor, but I am so impressed by this hotel. My wife is Parisian and we left the children with my mother-in-law for a one night romantic escape. It was superb; the location is wonderful - a historic and bustling street in a equally impressive area, but the hotel is just splendid. Small enough to feel intimate and personal but large enough not to feel cramped. The room (de Maitre was ours) are comfortable, the breakfast delicious, the decor thoughtful throughout, but what was magnificent was the attitude and approach of every member of staff at all times. They deserve the highest praise. We shall return!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location, Really Special Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeirdreKerry
Reviews.Content: Just back from a great three day break, staying at this hotel for our anniversary. We can't say enough good about it. Welcome on arrival, beautiful reception area, and our bedroom overlooked the atmospheric streets of the St Germaine area of Paris. The location is so great, we just got the train from CDG Airport directly to the Metro Stop St Michel and the hotel was only a five minute walk away. We had room 64 on the top floor and it was perfect. Really romantic hotel and the perfect getaway. We didn't eat at the hotel as the breakfast seemed fairly pricy at €20 per person - but why would you when there are the most fab restaurants and cafes right outside the door. This is one of the best hotels we have stayed in - ever and fully lived up to the recommendations on Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise - Charming”
Reviews.Author: DDG609
Reviews.Content: Please keep in mind that this was the hotel located at 22 Rue de Buci in Paris. There is another hotel by the same name on the same street. This hotel was charming, the staff was wonderful and the location excellent. Would stay there again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Over size rooms”
Reviews.Author: UG-Traveller
Reviews.Content: People who travel Paris knows how small the rooms are... but Buci is quite different, at least the room I stayed... The location is perfect, one of the most popular location of town, full of cafes, restaurants around. Its a great choice to have a weekend at Paris ...

Reviews.Title: “A lovely gem in the 6th!”
Reviews.Author: bcm21mk
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel de Buci earlier this month. It is a small boutique hotel in the heart of the St. Germain des Pres area. The hotel has been meticulously renovated and the rooms , albeit small, are elegant and beautiful. The staff was most gracious and professional. One of the concierges, Gregoire, deserves a special thank you for allowing us to change rooms without hesitation for an issue we had. The breakfast room is beautiful, with a wonderful assortment of breakfast treats. The location was ideal and it was a pleasure to return to the Hotel after a day of sightseeing.We would not hesitate to return on a future trip to Paris and highly recommend it to other travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jrb72_london
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 2 night weekend stay and loved it. The hotel is in a really small, narrow and busy street. We had booked a superior room but were lucky enough to be upgraded to a suite. The hotel is very clean and tidy. our room was very niice and equipped with 2 flat screen tv's, ipod dock, haridryer and tea/coffee facilities. The staff that we met were all very friendly and happy to help with anything. i cant comment on ease of tubes etc as we either walked or got cabs. The location is the real bonus of staying here. There are plenty of cafes, bars and shops in the immediate area and the Louvre, Luxembourge Gardens and Notre Dame are within easy walking distance. We didnt have breakfast at the hotel, but instead walked to one of the cafes and had a paris style breakfast instead. The cafes and bars int he area stay open late so its easy to have a relaxing after dinner drink or nightcap right next to the hotel in the early hours and watch the world go by. All in all, I would definately stay here again on any future paris trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: laksko
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend trip with the family and I had high expectations as the price was on the high side as we booked the Suite de Madame Lafayette. The suite is located on the top floor, overlooking the Rue de Buci. It's a great boutique hotel in a fantastic part of Paris. Service was impeccable and the staff very friendly and attentive. American breakfast is very well prepared and of high quality, much better than most of the 4 star hotels I stay in when visiting Paris for business. Free (and stable) internet throughout the hotel adds to my positive impressions! I would stay here again and I've already recommended this hotel to friends and colleagues!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and gorgeous hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KLSarah
Reviews.Content: Located a stones throw from so many great resaurants and bars and yet so peaceful and calm. Rooms are very stylish and staff helpful. Walking distance from metros and Louvre, Notre Dame. Great

Reviews.Title: “C'est magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: artistravel
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in Paris where I stayed in a suite at the Hotel de Buci, and I highly recommend it! The facility is very clean and attractively decorated in an old European style. Bathroom was updated and roomy (by European standards). The location in St. Germain/Latin Quartier is fantastic -- central to everything and in a lively, cheerful neighborhood where tourists and locals mix. The staff is exceptional, particularly the two female concierges who worked there during my stay. They spoke perfect English (and patiently tolerated my occasional attempts at conversing with them in French), and they were extremely pleasant and helpful with directions, reservations, restaurant recommendations, etc. Charming breakfast room with generous buffet breakfast included in room rate. Overall, very good value for the money. Will definitely stay there again when I return to Paris in the future.

Reviews.Title: “So lovely and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: luv2trv
Reviews.Content: Lovely boutique hotel in perfect location. Location was a lively area filled with Cafes. Able to walk to all major tourist sites. Could not decide on a hotel in Paris. I wanted a good location as I knew it was going to be a quick trip and my husband had never visited the city before. Made the right choice. Our room was small but it was extremely clean, modern and staff was so wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Ewelyn
Reviews.Content: First trip to Paris- was not disappointed. Hotel de Buci was beautiful. Room was really lovely. Bed very comfy. Room and hotel spotlessly clean. Definitely recommend this hotel. Location couldn't be better- close to everything including RER St Michel.

Reviews.Title: “ideally placed and comfortable too.”
Reviews.Author: runsinthefamily
Reviews.Content: Very well placed off Boulevard St Germain with plenty of cafes nearby. Rooms more than adequate by Paris standards and even at the front we weren't disturbed by outside noise late at night. Hotel staff extremely pleasant but not all up to speed with deals avaiolable on museums etc. Recommendations for restaurants change daily in the foyer and all proved to be well chosen and good value for dinner. Local cafes excellent (and cheaper than the hotel) for breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Plove36
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our first visit to Paris. It was such a lively area, with great shops and restaurants ( especially Papa's on the next block). Rooms were very clean and very nicely decorated. The staff went above and beyond to help us get information to Beauvais Tille airport and overall service was exceptional. We will definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Room does the job”
Reviews.Author: rich55UK
Reviews.Content: On arrival the receptionist was very helpful. We arrived 3 hours before we were allowed to get our room but he managed to get our room finished early. Overall very helpful staff. The room was small but nicely decorated, the bed was comfortable, aircon easy to use, bathroom clean and modern. Small gripe was the hotel forgot to top us up with tea and milk. (tiny issue.) Another problem was we were on the top floor. Above the window (on outside wall) there is a bright spotlight which lets a lot of light into the window. Had I not been so tired this would have been an issue. Advise would be to get light turned of or stay on lower floor. We didn't have breakfast there so cant comment but dining area looked clean and ok.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, wonderfull location, very good staff”
Reviews.Author: abtrix
Reviews.Content: I loved the Hotel De Buci. I´m a travel agent, I sold the hotel before successfully, and for the first time I stayed at the Buci. The location is wonderful, lots of restaurants around, the room has a good size for Paris, the staff is very friendly and the breakfast was really good, with baguettes and croissants just perfects!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with nicely redone but tiny rooms & bedbugs...”
Reviews.Author: SuitNflipflops
Reviews.Content: Normally, I start reviews with the good but here I'm going to start with the bad since you may not bother reading the rest of my review afterwards. So, for the bad: - Bedbugs: As a frequent traveler, I've checked in 300-400 times in hotels over the past 9 years of so and I've run into bedbugs once with Hotel Buci being the second. I killed one with a tissue and brought it in the bloody tissue to the the front desk where the attendant looked at it and said (in French) "This is a bedbug (une puce)" before throwing it away and ignoring my comment. At the very least, stay away from room 44. - Room size is tiny, under 90 sq. ft (not including the bathroom), which made it very stuffy especially since it faced a wall For the good: - Great location in the heart of the 6th arrondissment - Recently and very tastefully redone - Modern bathroom - Affordable rate for Paris Personally, I'm not surprised that "Buci" means "Buttocks" in Romanian. I wish I had known that before staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel and very helpful staff, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: NLP_11
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris and I absolutely loved it, Hotel De Buci definitely contributed to that. The staff were very helpful and attentive, being that i stayed there with my boyfriend (who's a Techie) we had a mini-freak out when we realized that we didn't have enough adapters for all our electronics. But we called the front desk and within 3 minutes they showed up with two adapters at our door. Our rooms were cozy but very elegant and having sound proof windows really helped at night... as it does get loud in the evening when people go out to party at local night clubs and such. But do watch ouT for the shower door as if you don't close it at the right angle you could end up soaking the floor :P If we ever had any problems deciding where to go or what to do with our day, whether it be suggesting a good watch store or finding a nice french restaurant they gave us great advice. Overall, we had a great experience and the neighborhood is absolutely superb! can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel, in good shape, in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Repsac342
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. The rooms are a little small and some are in need of updating, though not to the point that it would change my mind about staying there again. The rooms have adequate bathrooms with good water pressure and a good functioning hair dryer. The rooms also have air conditioning and heat with opening windows. The hotel also offers breakfast, a mini bar, in room coffee and tea, and free wireless internet, in addition to a computer that anyone can use. The staff is friendly, helpful, and speaks English. The neighborhood around the hotel is lively, but the windows for the hotel easily block out the sound from the street below. There are many restaurants around the neighborhood for anything from a nice dinner to a croissant for breakfast. There's also a nice grocery store just around the corner. The hotel is within short walking distance of three metro stops in addition to Notre Dame, Jardin du Luxembourg, the Louvre, and Musee d'Orsay. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Weird noise at night”
Reviews.Author: mimikaayu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel just recently for 3 nights. Location is 15 min walk to metro. There are many restaurants and cafe downstairs. There is also groceries close by for those who don't want to have hotel breakfast. The rooms are pretty clean though small but it's Paris. The bathroom has a weird design. The shower only has a half door so when you shower the bathroom is entirely wet, which is very inconvenient. There is a weird noise like some sort of machine that keeps going every night and it's impossible to sleep. Overall the hotel is nice but the noise at night is annoying and it's not that close to the metro. I give it a 3/5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Superb Staff”
Reviews.Author: JuanC
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Buci was a pleasant surprise on recommendation of a friend. The heart of the hotel is its people...the staff are excellent and make service a priority. The rooms are well-appointed and, above all, very clean. The neighborhood is busy day and night, but it's off the main, loud thoroughfares. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Compact but well appointed”
Reviews.Author: RubyrooLondon
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms are small, but you've got everything you need in a great location. We had two rooms on different floors, both with rear facing windows and no view, but when we saw how noisy the front road was we were quite pleased with that. The buffet breakfast was OK (cooked breakfast not the best quality) and seemed expensive but when we factored in how much it would cost in a cafe it was worth paying for the convenience of having a leisurely stroll downstairs to a bottomless cup of decent coffee and available until a civilised 11am. We were a family group with rooms across 2 floors so we frequently used the stairs between the rooms and most times we found a vacuum cleaner with a very long hose draped over the stairs (also the fire exit!) We pointed this out so I hope this has now been rectified. Shower doors were useless in both rooms (ours had part of the door missing) and the bathrooms were usually soaking wet, which explained why they supply 4 bath mats per room. Its a bit hit and miss what you get in the rooms, one of our rooms had an iron, ipod dock and got biscuits, needless to say ours didn't have any of this and we had the ipod! Tip - don't forget to put the 'make up the room sign' on the door or you don't get your toiletries and drinks replenished Concierge staff were great and did everything they could to book us last minute on to various boat trips. Overall - nice hotel, great staff and fabulous, lively location which mean't we overlooked the minor irritations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoBob2009
Reviews.Content: I was so happy with the location of this small hotel. The street was one of the most lively and exciting streets in the area-- because it is so narrow very few cars venture down this rue and it becomes a "walking mall" with shops and cafes. We had one of our best meals in Paris just a few steps away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and the fabulous Mr. Sanjay, Too!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaLu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 9 nights at the hotel and found it to be a wonderful spot. You can't beat the St. Germain area for cafes and nightlife and it is in walking distance to so many of the major sights. Although small, the room was very clean and comfortable and the bath quite large by European standards. Considering it is in the heart of cafe society, it was excellent value for your dollar. And yes, Mr.Sanjay, was very professional and friendly--helped us with a superb car service to and from the airport and managed to secure an excellent table at the front of the Bateau Mouches for a dinner cruise on the Seine. He provided us with a list of possible restaurants without our even asking. He's top notch and his young colleagues at the hotel would do well to learn from his polished style. We did not eat at the hotel with so many choices just steps away. Be sure to ask for a room away from the main street as Paris is abuzz with activities in to the early morning hours. FloridaLu, Jacksonville, FL

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, But not for the Price”
Reviews.Author: francofille12
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night as I had to come in from another part of France to meet a friend. Originally, i wanted to stay at one of its sister hotels, but waited until the last minute and couldn't book. All posters are right that this is a terrific neighborhood. Hotel is located about 4 blocks from the St. Germain des Pres metro, an easy walk even with luggage. It sits on Rue de Buci right off Boulevard St. Germain is in the middle of a charming neighborhood filled with restaurants, cafes, bars, shops and a market...you will NEVER get bored staying here. The hotel was clean and the amenities were nice but it was nothing terribly remarkable and I feel like it only got its 4 stars because it affects and air of superiority whereas some of its sister establishments which might not be rated as highly are actually better hotels and a better value. The staff that I encountered were not particularly friendly and nothing about it makes me die to go back but the cute little neighborhood. And definitely skip the breakfast...there is a Paul's across the street, no need to spend 20 euros on coffee and bread. It will be interesting to see what improvements are made when the renovation is finally finished this year. Though i haven't been in since I stayed there, I have been by it many times since and it looks pretty much the same from the outside.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for our romantic trip!”
Reviews.Author: puddleduck1979
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris for three nights and stayed in this hotel - it was a special occasion, my 30th birthday and also, it turned out, my boyfriend proposing to me! The hotel was absolutely excellent and really made our trip. When we arrived they upgraded us for free to their Junior Suite, which was amazing. The staff were very helpful and friendly, and we were delighted with the 'turn-down service' and chocolates on the pillow every night! The hotel is in the best location - Rue du Buci has loads going on with cafes and bars and restaurants and clubs, and is right on the main St Germain road with nearby metro station and other shops and sights. We had the best stay here, and it was the perfect choice for my birthday and proposal! We even chose my engagement ring in a shop just up the road. Thank you so much for a memorable trip to Paris, Hotel de Buci!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location- terrific staff”
Reviews.Author: Travellers022
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay her in July. The location was superb- the local neighbourhood was excellent with shops, cafes, ambiance; it was also very accessible to nearby attractions as well as the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and quirky”
Reviews.Author: mrwatson
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Buci is a charming typical left bank hotel. The location is fabulous - just off the Blvd St. Germain and a block and a half from the Seine. The hotel is a bit quirky - sloping hallways, some "American" baths, some traditional WCs, a few rooms where the window is superfluous as it overlooks an airshaft - but it's charming nonethless. Breakfast is delicious! Great selection and was included in our room price. Also, the internet access worked like a charm - it was so fast it practically turned on our laptop by itself. i'd go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - but the rest probably average”
Reviews.Author: niresh77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just off Boulevard Saint Germain in the heart of the bustling St. Germain area, surrounded by so many bars and restaurants that you'll be overwhelmed with choice. It's absolutely fantastic! The hotel itself I thought was ok, but not 4 stars. The room was big but the decoration and furniture...a bit rough around the edges. For example the walls weren't painted...I guess that was supposed to look cool, but it really didn't. The wardrobe and TV cupboard looked like they came straight from the flea market rather than a designer shop. The bathroom was a really good size, with shower over bath, nice toiletries. The bed was big, but not so comfortable to sleep on because it had 2 single sized mattresses instead of a double. And if you are slightly claustrophobic, you will hate the corridor that leads to the rooms. It's so tiny that only one person could pass through at a time. The breakfast room is in the basement, very quaint and "French". The choice at the buffet: very basic. What I score highly, apart from the fantastic location, was the free WiFi and the friendly staff. So all in all, a good hotel for a night or two, could do with a bit more attention given to the furniture and decoration of the rooms. Pretty overpriced though at €265 that I had to pay for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quaint hotel with excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel1976
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a week after booking an Expedia vacation. Great location, in heart of St. Germain du Pres, and excellent service at front desk. It was also not too expensive. I would highly recommend it. Only complaint, if on lower levels and facing street, it can get a little loud at night.

Reviews.Title: “Classic charm of small Parisian hotel in center of trendy active St. Germaine-des-Pres neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: washbrol
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Buci is a small classic charming hotel located in one of Paris' most elegant, active and beautiful neighborhoods, St. Germaine-des-Pres. (6th arrondissement) On a small side street only steps from the bustling Boulevard St. Germaine and Metro Odeon, Hotel Buci is surrounded by numerous neighborhood streetside cafes popular with young Parisiens, university students and locals in the know. Charming. Very Parisien. And great restaurants are everywhere. The room was small, but standard for Paris, with classic decoration involving floral printed wallpaper and/or linens and perhaps the charm of an exposed wooden beam or two on the cieling. Breakfast is served in the basement breakfast room. But at the cost of 18euro, much wiser to visit the many cafes or bakeries right outside the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of getting ripped off”
Reviews.Author: ApricotHill
Reviews.Content: When I checked in, the manager noted that I had booked through Expedia and I stressed that I had booked a superior room with a street view. Nevertheless, the manager assigned me a relatively attractive room with only a looming wall as a "view". I immediately returned to the front desk and reiterated having paid for a superior category street view room. The manager then offered me a dreary absolutely tiny room (garret really) with a street view. To avoid further hassle, I accepted the cell with view. The next night (my last) I noticed my "room" was designated standard, and the listed nightly rate was $65 less than I had paid through Expedia! I do not recommend that you book this hotel through Expedia. The location is really great, but next time I'll be back at the otherwise far, far superior Abbaye St. Germain.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: KnightsofNiFleet
Reviews.Content: I took my wife for a 2 day break in paris to celebrate her 40th birthday and found this gem of a hotel in the heart of Paris. Before arriving I emailed the hotel to let them know it was a special occasion to find on arrival that we had been upgraded to a junior suite with a half bottle of champagne on ice ready for us in the room. The room although on the small side was perfect for a couple of days. The best part about this hotel is it's location, right in the heart of the Paris with it's narrow streets with an abundance of cafes, restaurants and shops right outside the door. The metro is really close by allowing you to get to all the main sites easily but on a nice day many of the sites are in easy walking distance Notre Dame, the Louvre, Place de la Concorde etc. The Eiffel tower and the Sacre Coeur do need a train ride though! All in all a great little hotel with excellent service right in a superb location. The only downside of the whole trip was the depressing € : £ exchange rate and the fact that Paris is the world's 3rd most expensive city!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrankieBerkshire
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Paris and a 3 night stay at the Buci. What a great place to stay! Very easy to find, fantastic transport connections (metro/bus etc) and walkable to the Louvre, Notre Dame, d'Orsay etc. On the door step amazing restaurants, bakeries, designer shops (if thats your thing) and artists studios. The front desk staff were polite and friendly, the rooms decorated really nicely, the bed comfortable and amenities (hairdryer/ iron/ cotton wool/ robes/ slippers etc) ample. The only reason i haven't gone for a 5 star review was that the room was so hot - in Jan! We turned the heating off and air con on but opening the window was the only thing that would cool the room down so we could hear amourous neighbours if you catch my drift. Oh well - If you can't beat 'em, join 'em :) All in all a great hotel in an amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: shoppermom
Reviews.Content: What a lovely boutique hotel in one of the best neighborhoods in Paris! My husband and I were celebrating our 25th anniversary and the staff treated us like royalty. They included complimentary breakfasts for us for two nights and were extremely accomodating for all of our needs.The rooms are a bit small but comfortable and quiet even though this is a very busy area at night. They are so many cafes and great little boutiques for shopping nearby. I would highly recommend this hotel if you want to be in a great area and looking for a hotel with very personalized service. A great value!

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay anywhere else!!”
Reviews.Author: afcb0k
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel in an excellent area of Paris. Walk out and take breakfast in Pauls Bakery opposite(don't pay the hotels breakfast price!) then turn left or right and you have restaurants, bars, shops galore on your doorstep. Rue de Buci is a narrow road just off Boulevard St Germain and is in what feels like an "upmarket" area. Our room on the top floor had a view of Notre Dame (if you opened the window!) and proved to be warm, comfortable and we heard very little noise from the busy street below. Notre Dame and the Louvre are a 10 minute walk away and you have 3 metro stations within a 3 minute walk. Room was well appointed, very clean if a little small. We arrived late and the night porter was a little unwelcoming but otherwise staff were good. We very much enjoyed being able to walk out , have a good meal, take in the atmosphere and wander back to the hotel without the need for metro/taxi/bus ect........will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: bderk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in Sept. Having never been to Europe, a lot of research was done trying to find the hotel and location that would meet our expectations. If you are looking to stay close to attractions and shopping, this spot can't be beat. I was looking for something close to the action yet also in an area that had tiny narrow streets and many cafes and restaurants. That's exactly where this hotel is located. Some of my most enjoyable moments were getting up in the morning and going across the street to the tiny bakery for coffee and bagels and to watch the area come alive in the morning. Just a block or so away is Le Procope, Paris' oldest restaurant. We stumbled on it and were extremely pleased with the ambience, history and food. Unless you're getting the superior room at Le Buci, be prepared to pretty much have to move your suitcase to get out of the room. We upgraded to a superior room, it was well worth it. The young fellow taking care of breakfast in the mornings was very helpful with direction or anything else we needed. Excellent place to stay. Would personally not find a reason to gamble on another hotel the next time. It will be Hotel Le Buci.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: mcgovernkk
Reviews.Content: I took my 16 yr. old granddaughter to Paris for the first time the end of June. My daughter (her aunt) and husband also joined us. Staff were extremely pleasant and helpful; cafes were on the corner for breakfast/dinner. Neighborhood itself is wonderful and easily accessible to museums and the major Paris attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, but not great climate control for summer”
Reviews.Author: SMFToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: Great location, and great staff. Free internet, and lovely room in the basement. My biggest complaints are that when we were there, the english language channels on TV were not working. Also the weather was extremely hot, and air conditioning in the room was not up to the task. Would stay there again in cooler weather, but not in the very hot weather.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: mrsje
Reviews.Content: We were sorry to leave Hotel de Buci. It is an absolute gem of a hotel, and we really loved it. You get a good impression as you walk through the door, the staff are very friendly and helpful and our room, which was on the 2nd floor and overlooked the street, was very prettily furnished and spotlessly clean. The bathroom was also very clean and quite well equipped. Although the hotel is set in a bustling area, there was no noise or intrusive light in the room while sleeping, due to the electric blinds which cover the windows outside at night. Not many people seemed to take breakfast (others have reported here that it was a bit pricey) but we enjoyed it each day with part waiter service. The hotel setting in the St Germain des Pres area is amid a wonderful interesting mxture of little art galleries, shops and cafes - we were only a few minutes from the metro, and could easily walk to the Louvre, Notre Dame etc. Congratulations to all who work to make this such a lovely hotel, this was our fifth visit to the city, and this is the nicest Paris hotel we have stayed in by far. We look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and delightful”
Reviews.Author: cynspeed
Reviews.Content: What a charming hotel. Great location, lots and lots of cafes and markets all around the area. A five minute stroll to 2 subway locations and a Starbucks, it you are into that. A 10 minute walk to the Louvre. The staff were sweet and kind, There is a free to use computer in the downstairs breakfast area if you want to get e-mail, otherwise, wifi is a charge. I went alone, and I felt very comfortable and safe the whole time. It is a little pricey, I will say that, but half of the cost was a present from my husband, so that softened the sting. The breakfast downstairs in the hotel is really pricey, but there is a sweet cafe across the street, Pauls that is reasonable and good. There is also a grocery store down the street. I thought the room was good, some may find it a little dowdy, the bath was clean and modern. If you have any questions, just write.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blondie07030
Reviews.Content: Travel to Paris for work, found this hotel to be so personal, clean, and comfortable.. First of all, the staff could not have been nicer, even drawing out a map for my tourist destinations and making suggestions on places to visit. My room itself was extremely clean and smelled so fresh every day. It was not huge in size, but enough to be cozy for one person (#13). Location. Location. Location. You could walk to Notre Dame, Louvre, other museums, to the River Seine, and many many others. Quaint feeling, amazing restaurants and shopping all nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Just right!”
Reviews.Author: JenSaysThis
Reviews.Content: First off, I should say that this was my fifth visit to Paris, and my first visit exclusively for pleasure. My past visits were arranged by production companies, so I had little choice over where I stayed. Each earlier visit to Paris had me staying in a tiny hotel room with ancient amenities. I came to realize that tiny hotel rooms are the standard in Paris. Hotel de Buci is no exception. The difference here is that they utilize every inch of space well, and the amenities are clean and modern. The main reason to stay here is the location- right in the heart of chic Germain St. Dupres. Hotel de Buci is set on a busy street lined with real Parisian restaurants (not the ones designed for tourists). Yet despite being on a busy street, the noise doesn't reach your bedroom. The weekend of my visit, we learned there was a metro strike. All the public bicycles were reserved by locals to commute to and from work. No problem -- our hotel was a comfortable walk away from Notre Dame, The Louvre, and the Eiffel Tour. By the time we got the major attractions out of the way, the strike let up and we were able to use the metro to see other areas of Paris. Another reason to stay at Hotel de Buci: the lovely host Charlotte! Upon your arrival, she will do her best to make you feel welcome. If you have a particular destination you'd like to see, Charlotte will point it out on a map and look up the hours for you. One suggestion: Breakfast is pricey, and not included in the rate. As an alternative - Wake up early in the AM, run across the street to the boulangerie, and pick up some freshly baked bread and coffee. C'est bon!

Reviews.Title: “Fell in Love 17 Times”
Reviews.Author: letsoh
Reviews.Content: Hotel De Buci was the best hotel and really inexpensive for the area. Near the Notre Dame, my girlfriend and I had the best time. The location was awesome and staff were very friendly and helpful. The view, location, price, and romantic atomsphere make this a great place to stay while Paris. Booked through Eurostar and got a wonderful deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: Tookstar
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews of the Buci, particularly regarding their service, I was a little apprehensive in booking it. However the location was perfect and I decided to chance it. It turned out to be the best hotel of our trip. Not only was the location as perfect as I expected, the service was also great. The staff assisted us with all our enquiries and even gave us a fabulous restaurant recommendation. The room was "Parisianly compact", but comfortable and modern and we even had a glimpse of Notre Dame from the top floor. We have been to Paris 4 times and always stayed in the same area but never the same hotel twice. This time we found a hotel that we will return to.

Reviews.Title: “Very very good”
Reviews.Author: NicL
Reviews.Content: A small personal 4 star hotel (assume family owned - it seemed like it). Clean and very tasteful decor and trimmings. Staff were extremely helpful and attentive. Room was ok in size but might be a bit small for some staying many nights. Room is well appointed though and bed extremely comfy (and I am fussy). A good simple breakfast in a lovely lounge-type room was a good way start the day. Best of all though is the fab location on a side street just off the Boulevard St Germain. Loads of atmospherica bars and restaurant, shops and eateries surround and the whole atmosphere is one of what you expect Paris to be like - wonderful. Cost of £120 per night for the room was very good value for this hotel. Without doubt would have no hesitation in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zoe15
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel De Buci for one night in October 2007. We were in Paris for an extended stay at another hotel earlier in the month and chose the De Buci for our last night of the trip because of its superb location, in the heart of St. Germain surrounded by shops and cafes. Maybe it was our room or that we prefer modern as opposed to traditional French decor, but the experience wasn't four star--except for the robe and slippers. For example, the bed was incredibly uncomfortable with the mattress sagging so much in the middle that my husband ended up sleeping on the floor. We twice asked for another set of towels--only one was provided in the bathroom--and never received it (another request was answered right away). On the plus side, the room was clean and quiet with wi-fi and CNN and most staff appeared helpful. Overall, it's a decent hotel with an amazing location--just not worth $300 for us but maybe for others.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, delightful staff”
Reviews.Author: DaisyatTrip
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Hotel de Buci in September. I was really struck by the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. They really made the stay exceptional. The location is perfect, although the price is high. The room was pretty and comfortable (though small) and many small details were taken care of. Our room overlooked a fairly unattractive courtyard, but since it was quiet we had no complaints about that. At all times of day and night, you can walk out of the hotel & be in the thick of St. Germain action! I would return to this hotel. (By the way, don't count on getting a taxi from this neighborhood during busy periods. Give yourself a lot of time or make alternative arrangements)

Reviews.Title: “Good location - not so sure about the service”
Reviews.Author: Canberra_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Our friends chose this hotel and we decided to join them for 2 nights. The location can't be beaten - the street oozes charm and Parisian character and is lively till the late hours. You don't hear noise because the windows are double glazed and fitted with shutters which close at the press of a button. The foyer is compact but smart and comfortable and the check in was welcoming. Our room was a deluxe double overlooking the street and by Paris standards, was average size. It was smartly decorated in traditional French style. The bathroom was fine although the hand held shower kept slipping down the wall making for some frustrating showers. The air conditioning system was not efficient and the room was never really cool enough - even though the weather wasn't hot. The moods of the staff varied. Whilst the female day staff were pleasant and tried to be helpful, the male night staff definitely let the side down. They were at times officious and lazy. we were disappointed when we returned tired from our day out and found our room hadn't been serviced - by 4.30pm! We paid 250 euros a night without breakfast, booking through the hotel website. Whilst the hotel is well located, in my opinion it's not good value nor good enough to return to.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: fc1
Reviews.Content: First the positives - the location IS unbeatable. In the heart of St Germain it is two spits from the coolest people watching bar (Bar du Marche) in Paris (and therefore surely the World) plus countless other restaurants and bars, 3 mins from the Seine and 10 from the Louvre. Now to the negatives, unfortunately... The reviews commenting on the rude staff (at least the night-time staff) are oh so true. To cut a very long story short, the smallest request (to turn a double into a twin, as we had booked and as the day staff (who were very professional) had promised would be done was met with eye rolling, huffs and puffs, truculence, downright arguing and (no kidding) a quilt being thrown across the (very small) room in rage (after I came in and found the 'twin' beds were 2cms apart and shared a quilt and dared to say "oh, could we please have separate quilts since we won't be sharing a bed at all"). After this I complained to the night-time manager who simply made excuses for the staff member concerned and attributed blame to us. His attitude wasn't altogether surprising since when, the next morning, when we asked him to book us a cab, we got similar eye-rolling and huffs. Of lesser impact on our break but things to bear in mind: (a) yes the rooms are very small (although you should accept that you'll find that throughout Europe) and looked out on a courtyard and the air-conditioner; (b) for a period in the evening the room stank of smoke - maybe from the next room or maybe from the dour (cleaning?) woman who skulked around the lobby smoking constantly) and (c) the bathroom door didn't lock or close properly. I'd agree with other reviewers who expressed surprise that this is a 4*. Stay here if location is important and a little Gallic attitude will add to your trip to Paris, but come prepared...pack your boxing gloves!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: OzTraveller20
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for several nights. Wow. This hotel was fantastic in a superb location. A bit pricey but then so are all hotels in Paris. Paid 215 Euros for a double room [it was for one person]. The location of this hotel on the Rue de Buci in the heart of Saint Germain cannot be beaten. The hotel is quiet yet you step out the front door of the hotel and you are in the middle of all the action. There are cafes galore and fabulous restaurants within walking distance. I requested a room at the back of the hotel overlooking the courtyard and it was extremely quiet - no noise at all and I slept like a baby. My only gripe is the hotel rules [never verbally pointed out but located in written material in the hotel room - you can always say you never saw it!] which state that you are "not allowed outside food in the room". I thought this demand was outrageous and just ignored it and had cornflakes in my room every day for breakfast rather than pay 22 Euros for the hotel breakfast. My attitude is if I am paying 215 Euros a night I will eat whatever I please in my room! In my opinion this little "rule" of the hotel's should be removed from the hotel rule book. On the other hand quite often I would walk into the hotel with grocery bags and staff saw it and said nothing so maybe it's one of those rules that's meant to be broken? Staff at this hotel are incredibly helpful and wonderful. There is a big Champion supermarket 10 metres from the hotel and a superb fruit stall selling top quality fruit right across the street. I liked the Hotel Buci and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The Quintessential Paris Experience”
Reviews.Author: Crae19
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel quite by accident, thinking it another. What a great mistake! My first time in Paris and I couldn't have wished for a better place to stay. Although the rooms are small. They are immaculate and cute. Bathrooms are modern. I stayed in 62 on the top floor over looking the street. FABULOUS! With a window balcony and view of NotreDame and the bustling street life below. I will do many paintings from views snapped from this room. Also the sound proofing blocked out the street and there was never noise from ajoining rooms. The location was amazing. Close to Cafes, shops Poulin Bakery (a MUST) and sidewalk cafes were open late so you never feel rushed. Metro a very easy few minutes walk away. The down side? Only the price. And do insist on on a street room as there is NO view at all on the courtyard room except into the apartments across the way. The bilingual staff was very friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. I will most certainly stay there on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmm - maybe its just the Aussie Peso!”
Reviews.Author: Christopher88
Reviews.Content: Well there is no doubt this hotel is located in a very cool part of Paris. Its hard not to part with plenty of Euros sitting in the sidewalk cafes with a drink watching the world go by. There are a number of great restaurants nearby and getting around to the rest of the sights in the city is easy. After an excellent introduction by the exceptionally helpful front desk staff the hotel was a bit disappointing. Our room was located on the first floor above the street, which was great to see things from, but to get a decent nights sleep, we had to close the windows and the electric steel shutters, and rely on the airconditioning. It didnt help that on the second day the remote for the air con disappeared after the room was serviced. Other negatives for us included: - Hard beds and two single beds pushed together. This seems to be common in Europe however, in the city of love - it is a bit annoyin to spend the night sleeping in the gap! - Small shower and small room Overall we wouldnt stay here again and thought it was over priced, although as Australians our dollar doesnt go far in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with Hotel De Buci”
Reviews.Author: megablst
Reviews.Content: Very impressed, paid a bit more per night that ideally I wanted too but as it turned out it was worth every penny. Location is perfect - Louvre within walking distance, metro near by etc etc. Hotel itself excellent, well presented, staff bright and cheerful, room well equipped and up to the 4 stars the hotel identifies itself as. Will stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good location& good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have spend few days at the DE BUCI and we had a wonderful stay. The staff was friendly & professional. All rooms are different and it is better to be facing the street. But the decoration is very French & elegant. We will recommand this place to our friend.

Reviews.Title: “Tourist Exploitation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went there for three days along with my fiance and I can honestly say that the hotel was quite a disappointment. Although the location is good, the rooms are very small and the one we stayed in had a horrible view with average decoration. Except from that, the main disadvatage of hotel de Buci is that it is expensive without offering a good value -if any-for the money it asks for. We paid around 250 euros per night for the room we stayed in without even having the breakfast included. Breakfast was served in a room below ground and seemed suffocating. Finally the lady in the reception hall that seems to be in charge of the guests is very unpolite and should perhaps take some hospitality courses before being assigned to the position that she is. All other employees were professional.

Reviews.Title: “Not first reccomendation”
Reviews.Author: KEK1976
Reviews.Content: I spend a weekend at this hotel and I wouldn't recommend it as a first choice. It is not a bad place but it is higly overrated and overpriced. I stayed in a tiny room (category superior!!) overooking an awful courtyard. The room didn't have any personality and a huge ugly semi-column was covering 1/3 of the free space. The management had a clear speculative policy towards the guests.The rate for this room was higher than most expensive rooms of the best hotels in the prettiest street of Saint Germain Rue Jacob. They had price listings for second-class & hand De Buci umbrellas and bath towels for more than 60 euros each. Most of the stuff were really professionals and very efficient in their duties except the daytime woman receptionist - she was really unfriedly and unpolite. It is really strange that this property has a 4-star rating. The rooms are very standard and the decors of the best 3-star hotels in Saint Germain are much more impressive. I don't think is a coincidence that in their website do not have clear images of their accomodation and surroundings.
